Text:
Thanks for the uploads, but you guys really need to work on your encoding.

The video quality is terrible, considering filesize and content. Try using x264 (if necessary x264vfw or x264vfw64).

Audio quality is also unnecessarily below par.

I see. 
Well, including the source (NeuLion, in some cases, I believe?) or something like a WEBRIP-tag would be nice.
